page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY OF TIDWORTH I
page.content: The village of Tidworth has been in existence for thousands of years. In Roman times it was a centre of commun- ication between London,Marlborough and Bath. The Anglo-Saxon name TUDWORTH meant TUDAS HOMESTEAD. By the middle of the seventeenth century the estates of Tedworth and the Manor of Tedworth House were well known to the Royal Court,Houses of Parliament and City of London. It was a centre for sheep breeding and the wool trade and known to British and European merchants. In l650 Thomas Smith became the new squire. He and his descendants were important people in the City of London and did much to maintain and develop the village. Thomas Assheton Smith III modified Tedworth House and formed Tedworth Hunt. The estates passed out of the Assheton Smith family in l859.
